|vendor_id = 413c |device_id = 9500 |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = <!-- Federal Communication Commission Identification Number --> |icid = <!-- Industry Canada ID, Leave blank for none --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Baord ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = <!-- OUI -->

|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |price = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- Newegg number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |manuf_country = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== Full-size module, but the top half is just a PCB spacer, the electronics are in the half-size section
Used in the Dell Mini 10 (1010), Dell P/N DW700 GPS
==Links of Interest== [https://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1440121 Thread about the module @ UbuntuForums] :The USB ID is noted as 413c:9500, one poster notes the Windows GPS utility notes the chi as BCM4750 A1
[[Category:English Documentation]]
